title: International Advisory Member (Gareth EVANS) | Asia-Pacific Leadership Network

quotes: Professor the Hon Gareth Evans AC KC FASSA FAIIA is Distinguished Honorary Professor at the Australian National University, where he was Chancellor 2010-19.
He was founding Convenor of the APLN in 2011, and Chair 2019-21.
He was founding Convenor of the APLN in 2011, and Chair 2019-21.

He was a Cabinet Minister in the Hawke and Keating Australian Governments for 13 years, including as Attorney-General (1983-84), Minister for Resources and Energy (1984–87), and Foreign Minister (1988–96).

He was a Cabinet Minister in the Hawke and Keating Australian Governments for 13 years, including as Attorney-General (1983-84), Minister for Resources and Energy (1984–87), and Foreign Minister (1988–96).

He was a Cabinet Minister in the Hawke and Keating Australian Governments for 13 years, including as Attorney-General (1983-84), Minister for Resources and Energy (1984–87), and Foreign Minister (1988–96).
After leaving Australian politics, he was President of the Brussels-based International Crisis Group from 2000 to 2009.
he co-chaired with Yoriko Kawaguchi the International Commission on Nuclear Non-proliferation and Disarmament (2009).

He was awarded the 2010 Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt Institute Freedom from Fear Award for his pioneering work on the responsibility to protect concept and his contributions to conflict prevention and resolution, arms control and disarmament.

quotes: Professor the Hon Gareth Evans AC KC FASSA FAIIA is Distinguished Honorary Professor at the Australian National University, where he was Chancellor 2010-19.

organizations.name: APLN (Asia-Pacific Leadership Network)
quotes: He was founding Convenor of the APLN in 2011, and Chair 2019-21.

organizations.name: Hawke and Keating Australian Governments
quotes: He was a Cabinet Minister in the Hawke and Keating Australian Governments for 13 years, including as Attorney-General (1983-84), Minister for Resources and Energy (1984–87), and Foreign Minister (1988–96).

organizations.name: Canberra Commission on the Elimination of Nuclear Weapons
quotes: He was a Cabinet Minister in the Hawke and Keating Australian Governments for 13 years, including as Attorney-General (1983-84), Minister for Resources and Energy (1984–87), and Foreign Minister (1988–96) when he initiated the Canberra Commission on the Elimination of Nuclear Weapons.

organizations.name: International Crisis Group
quotes: After leaving Australian politics, he was President of the Brussels-based International Crisis Group from 2000 to 2009.

organizations.name: Blix Commission on Weapons of Mass Destruction
quotes: Long engaged in nuclear policy issues, he was a member of the Blix Commission on Weapons of Mass Destruction and the Zedillo Commission on the Role of the IAEA to 2020 and Beyond, and co-chaired with Yoriko Kawaguchi the International Commission on Nuclear Non-proliferation and Disarmament (2009).
